problem: A square has a side length of 14 units. What is the length of the diagonal of the square?
solution: The diagonal of a square can be calculated using the formula $d = s\sqrt{2}$, where $s$ is the side length of the square. Substituting the given side length, $d = 14\sqrt{2}$. Hence, the diagonal length is $\boxed{14\sqrt{2}}$ units.
